title: How AI systems must prove trust, transparency and reliability before clinical use
description: Existing frameworks for explainable artificial intelligence (XAI) and AI governance, such as the EU AI Act and the NIST AI Risk Management Framework, offer broad principles on transparency and accountability. But as researchers note, they rarely tell engineering teams what exactly to build or test before clinical evaluation.
content: A team of researchers has developed a new blueprint designed to close the widening gap between AI research and its safe, trustworthy use in hospitals. Their study, titled “Before the Clinic: Transparent and Operable Design Principles for Healthcare A... [6820 chars]

title: ChatGPT drove users to suicide, psychosis and financial ruin: California lawsuits
description: OpenAI, the multibillion-dollar maker of ChatGPT, is facing seven lawsuits in California courts accusing it of knowingly releasing a psychologically manipulative and dangerously addictive artificial intelligence system that allegedly drove users to suicide, psychosis and financial ruin.

title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - AI Selloff Drags Nasdaq to Steep Weekly Decline Amid Market Concerns
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. title: Meta plans $600 billion US spend as AI data centers expand
description: Meta Platforms on Friday said it will invest $600 billion in U.S. infrastructure and jobs over the next three years, including artificial intelligence data centers, as the social media giant races to build infrastructure to power its AI ambitions.
content:
Meta has doubled down on AI, with a target of achieving superintelligence, a theoretical milestone where machines outthink humans.

title: Big Tech may win reprieve as EU mulls easing AI rules, document shows
description: Apple , Meta Platforms and other tech giants may win a reprieve from the EU's landmark artificial intelligence rules as regulators consider easing sections of the legislation as part of a drive to simplify a slew of regulations adopted in the last two years.
content:
The move by the European Commission came amid intense lobbying by big tech companies and criticism from the U.S. administration against the AI Act adopted last year, which applies risk-based rules to artificial intelligence.
